title: Fix Lily detail page engagement row placement (likes/replies/views always below content)

requirements.text: Update the Lily detail page (frontend/src/pages/LilyPage.tsx) so the engagement row (likes, replies, views) always renders in a fixed location directly below the lilyâ€™s main content block: title + description, then image (if present) and link (if present), then the engagement row. Do not change engagement row placement on feed cards or any other pages/components.

quotes: the likes replies and views in the lilypage should always be displayed below the image and description.
the only page that needs it is the lily page as far as i know

acceptanceCriteria: On the lily detail page, when a lily has an image, the likes/replies/views row appears below the image and below the description text (it is not shown above the image).
On the lily detail page, when a lily has no image, the likes/replies/views row still appears below the description (or below the title if there is no description).
The likes/replies/views row styling and functionality (like toggle, counts formatting) remain unchanged aside from its placement.
No layout/placement changes are made to the engagement row in frontend/src/components/LilyCard.tsx or other pages.

constraints: Frontend changes must not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep changes scoped to the Lily detail page layout; do not refactor backend or shared query hooks for this request.
nonGoals: Repositioning engagement metrics on feed cards or other post listings
Changing like/reply/view logic, counts, or backend behavior
